segment.source: How to Generate MBAM Reports
segment.target: How to Generate MBAM Reports

segment.source: How to Generate MBAM Reports
segment.target: How to Generate MBAM Reports

segment.source: How to Generate MBAM Reports
segment.target: How to Generate MBAM Reports

segment.source: When you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Stand-alone topology, you can generate different reports to monitor BitLocker encryption usage and compliance.
segment.target: When you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Stand-alone topology, you can generate different reports to monitor BitLocker encryption usage and compliance.

segment.source: The procedures in this topic describe how to open the Administration and Monitoring website and the steps that are needed to generate Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring reports on enterprise compliance, individual computers, and key recovery activity.
segment.target: The procedures in this topic describe how to open the Administration and Monitoring website and the steps that are needed to generate Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring reports on enterprise compliance, individual computers, and key recovery activity.

segment.source: For detailed information to help understand MBAM reports, see Understanding MBAM Reports.
segment.target: For detailed information to help understand MBAM reports, see Understanding MBAM Reports.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run the reports, you must be a member of the Report Users Role on the computers where the Administration and Monitoring Server features, Compliance and Audit Database, and Compliance and Audit Reports are installed.
segment.target: To run the reports, you must be a member of the Report Users Role on the computers where the Administration and Monitoring Server features, Compliance and Audit Database, and Compliance and Audit Reports are installed.

segment.source: To open the Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: To open the Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: The default URL for the Administration and Monitoring website is http://computername.
segment.target: The default URL for the Administration and Monitoring website is http://computername.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the Administration and Monitoring website was installed on a port other than 80, you have to specify the port in the URL (for example, http://computername:port.
segment.target: If the Administration and Monitoring website was installed on a port other than 80, you have to specify the port in the URL (for example, http://computername:port.

segment.source: If you specified a host name for the Administration and Monitoring website during the installation, the URL is http://hostname.
segment.target: If you specified a host name for the Administration and Monitoring website during the installation, the URL is http://hostname.

segment.source: In the left pane, click Reports and then select the report you want to run from the top menu bar.
segment.target: In the left pane, click Reports and then select the report you want to run from the top menu bar.

segment.source: Historical MBAM client data is retained in the compliance database for historical reference in case a computer is lost or stolen.
segment.target: Historical MBAM client data is retained in the compliance database for historical reference in case a computer is lost or stolen.

segment.source: When running enterprise reports, we recommend that you use appropriate start and end dates to scope the time frames for the reports from one to two weeks to increase reporting data accuracy.
segment.target: When running enterprise reports, we recommend that you use appropriate start and end dates to scope the time frames for the reports from one to two weeks to increase reporting data accuracy.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If SSRS was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer, the URL for the reports will be set to HTTP instead of to HTTPS when you install the MBAM Server.
segment.target: If SSRS was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer, the URL for the reports will be set to HTTP instead of to HTTPS when you install the MBAM Server.

segment.source: If you then go to the Help Desk portal and select a report, the following message displays: “Only Secure Content is Displayed.”
segment.target: If you then go to the Help Desk portal and select a report, the following message displays: “Only Secure Content is Displayed.”

segment.source: To show the report, click Show All Content.
segment.target: To show the report, click Show All Content.

segment.source: To generate an Enterprise Compliance Report
segment.target: To generate an Enterprise Compliance Report

segment.source: From the Administration and Monitoring website, select the Reports node from the left navigation pane, select Enterprise Compliance Report, and select the filters that you want to use.
segment.target: From the Administration and Monitoring website, select the Reports node from the left navigation pane, select Enterprise Compliance Report, and select the filters that you want to use.

segment.source: The available filters for the Enterprise Compliance Report are the following:
segment.target: The available filters for the Enterprise Compliance Report are the following:

segment.source: Compliance Status.
segment.target: Compliance Status.

segment.source: Use this filter to specify the compliance status types (for example, Compliant, or Noncompliant) of the report.
segment.target: Use this filter to specify the compliance status types (for example, Compliant, or Noncompliant) of the report.

segment.source: Error State.
segment.target: Error State.

segment.source: Use this filter to specify the error state types (for example, No Error, or Error) of the report.
segment.target: Use this filter to specify the error state types (for example, No Error, or Error) of the report.

segment.source: Click View Report to display the selected report.
segment.target: Click View Report to display the selected report.

segment.source: Results can be saved in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.
segment.target: Results can be saved in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The Enterprise Compliance report is generated by a SQL job that runs every six hours.
segment.target: The Enterprise Compliance report is generated by a SQL job that runs every six hours.

segment.source: Therefore, the first time you view the report, you may find that some data is missing.
segment.target: Therefore, the first time you view the report, you may find that some data is missing.

segment.source: You can generate updated report data manually by using SQL Management Studio.
segment.target: You can generate updated report data manually by using SQL Management Studio.

segment.source: From the Object Explorer window, expand SQL Server Agent, expand Jobs, right-click the CreateCache job, and select Start Job at Step….
segment.target: From the Object Explorer window, expand SQL Server Agent, expand Jobs, right-click the CreateCache job, and select Start Job at Step….

segment.source: Select a computer name to view information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: Select a computer name to view information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.
segment.target: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.

segment.source: To generate the Computer Compliance Report
segment.target: To generate the Computer Compliance Report

segment.source: In the Administration and Monitoring website, select the Report node from the left navigation pane, and then select the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: In the Administration and Monitoring website, select the Report node from the left navigation pane, and then select the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: Use the Computer Compliance report to search for user name or computer name.
segment.target: Use the Computer Compliance report to search for user name or computer name.

segment.source: Click View Report to view the computer report.
segment.target: Click View Report to view the computer report.

segment.source: Results can be saved in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.
segment.target: Results can be saved in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.

segment.source: Select a computer name to display more information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: Select a computer name to display more information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.
segment.target: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: An MBAM client computer is considered compliant if the computer matches the requirements of the MBAM policy settings.
segment.target: An MBAM client computer is considered compliant if the computer matches the requirements of the MBAM policy settings.

segment.source: To generate the Recovery Key Audit Report
segment.target: To generate the Recovery Key Audit Report

segment.source: From the Administration and Monitoring website, select the Report node in the left navigation pane, and then select the Recovery Audit Report.
segment.target: From the Administration and Monitoring website, select the Report node in the left navigation pane, and then select the Recovery Audit Report.

segment.source: Select the filters for your Recovery Key Audit report.
segment.target: Select the filters for your Recovery Key Audit report.

segment.source: The available filters for Recovery Key audits are as follows:
segment.target: The available filters for Recovery Key audits are as follows:

segment.source: Requestor.
segment.target: Requestor.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requester.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requester.

segment.source: The requester is the person in the Help Desk who accessed the key on behalf of a user.
segment.target: The requester is the person in the Help Desk who accessed the key on behalf of a user.

segment.source: Requestee.
segment.target: Requestee.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requestee.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requestee.

segment.source: The requestee is the person who called the Help Desk to obtain a recovery key.
segment.target: The requestee is the person who called the Help Desk to obtain a recovery key.

segment.source: Request Result.
segment.target: Request Result.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the request result types (for example, Success or Failed) that they want to base the report on.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the request result types (for example, Success or Failed) that they want to base the report on.

segment.source: For example, users may want to view failed key access attempts.
segment.target: For example, users may want to view failed key access attempts.

segment.source: Key Type.
segment.target: Key Type.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the Key Type (for example: Recovery Key Password or TPM Password Hash) that they want to base the report on.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the Key Type (for example: Recovery Key Password or TPM Password Hash) that they want to base the report on.

segment.source: Start Date.
segment.target: Start Date.

segment.source: This filter is used to define the Start Date part of the date range that the user wants to report on.
segment.target: This filter is used to define the Start Date part of the date range that the user wants to report on.

segment.source: End Date.
segment.target: End Date.

segment.source: This filter is used to define the End Date part of the date range that the users want to report on.
segment.target: This filter is used to define the End Date part of the date range that the users want to report on.

segment.source: Click View Report to view the report.
segment.target: Click View Report to view the report.

segment.source: Results can be saved in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.
segment.target: Results can be saved in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Monitoring and Reporting BitLocker Compliance with MBAM 2.0
segment.target: Monitoring and Reporting BitLocker Compliance with MBAM 2.0
